Package control

Class Prompt

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.Prompt
  • public class Prompt
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that offers different prompt types : mode prompt, name prompt, coordinates prompt and quit/save prompt. Every method is only designed for the value recovery. Every display functionnality (visual communication with the user) is handeld by the calling method. This way, the methods are more likely to be called by various methods.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    LÃ©o DESMONTS - IUT VANNES - 2020

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static char[] askForQuit()
      askForQuit asks the user for y/n to maybe launch the save/quit procedure
      static int[] inputCoordinates​(int SIZE)
      inputCoordinates asks the user for two Int, to form a coordinate (for a pawn to select of a move to make).
      static Mode inputMode()
      inputMode asks the user for an input, to select the gameMode : - HH (Human - Human) - HA (Human - Automated)
      static java.lang.String inputName()
      inputName asks the user for an input, to select a name for a player.

    • Method Detail

      • inputMode

        public static Mode inputMode()
        inputMode asks the user for an input, to select the gameMode : - HH (Human - Human) - HA (Human - Automated)
        Returns:
        Mode gameMode chosen by the user

      • inputName

        public static java.lang.String inputName()
        inputName asks the user for an input, to select a name for a player.
        Returns:
        String name of the player

      • inputCoordinates

        public static int[] inputCoordinates​(int SIZE)
        inputCoordinates asks the user for two Int, to form a coordinate (for a pawn to select of a move to make).
        Parameters:
        SIZE - is a int representing the size of the grid (is a square SIZExSIZE)
        Returns:
        int[] a tab of int of lenght 2

      • askForQuit

        public static char[] askForQuit()
        askForQuit asks the user for y/n to maybe launch the save/quit procedure
        Returns:
        a char tab with the user's answer \n\t *char[0] = 'y' => user wants to quit \n\t *char[1] = 'y' => user wants to save
